decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering and manipulating spells while using Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to filter through the deck. The deck includes a variety of counterspells and card draw spells to keep control of the board. Additionally, there are powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Reality Smasher to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes powerful lands like Wasteland and Maze of Ith to control the opponent's resources. Overall, the strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful creatures and spells to ultimately win the game.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence and quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and powerful equipment. Marath, Will of the Wild, serves as the commander, providing versatility and the ability to create more threats as needed. The deck includes a variety of mana ramp creatures like Birds of Paradise and Elvish Mystic, along with powerful creatures like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Avacyn's Pilgrim. Key cards like Birthing Pod and Skullclamp provide card advantage and utility, while equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte enhance the creatures' abilities. The deck aims to control the battlefield and apply pressure early on to secure a victory.

The key strategy of this deck is to utilize Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander in a Control archetype. The focus is on countering and controlling the opponent's plays while drawing cards and manipulating the board state. With a mix of counter spells like Force of Will, Mana Leak, and Cryptic Command, along with card draw spells such as Treasure Cruise and Dig Through Time, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Additionally, extra turn spells like Time Warp and Temporal Mastery are used to gain an advantage on the battlefield. With efficient card draw, counterspells, and Jace's abilities, the deck aims to control the game and secure a victory.

The key idea behind this deck is to quickly ramp up mana resources using mana dorks, enchantments, and land ramp spells to accelerate into big threats like Avenger of Zendikar, Primeval Titan, and Craterhoof Behemoth. Titania, Protector of Argoth's ability to create Elemental tokens from sacrificed lands synergizes with cards like Realms Uncharted, Scapeshift, and Life from the Loam to generate value and protect the commander. The deck also includes combo pieces like Birthing Pod and Summoner's Pact to tutor for specific creatures and win conditions. The strategy focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast mana acceleration and powerful creatures, leveraging the strength of green's ramp potential in a 1 vs 1 format.

The deck revolves around utilizing efficient and versatile creatures, along with powerful control spells, to put pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By deploying mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Elvish Mystic early on, the deck aims to ramp into threats like Tarmogoyf and True-Name Nemesis quickly. The inclusion of disruptive elements such as Aven Mindcensor and Gaddock Teeg helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy and give the deck an edge in the matchup. Control elements like Counterspell and Force of Will provide backup to protect the deck's threats and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggression while maintaining control of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing graveyard synergies to quickly assemble powerful combos and overwhelm opponents with a strong board presence. Karador, Ghost Chieftain serves as the commander, allowing for easy recursion of key creatures from the graveyard. The deck includes a mix of mana dorks, tutors, removal spells, and powerful finishers like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Primeval Titan. The use of creatures like Boonweaver Giant and Reveillark in combination with cards like Pattern of Rebirth and Survival of the Fittest enables powerful combos that can quickly end the game. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Gaddock Teeg helps to slow down opponents while the deck sets up its game-winning combos.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana and ramp into powerful threats while disrupting your opponent's resources. By utilizing mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Birds of Paradise, along with land destruction cards like Wasteland and Tectonic Edge, the deck aims to accelerate its own game plan while hindering the opponent's development. The deck includes a variety of utility creatures like Eternal Witness and Reclamation Sage to provide value and disruption. With a strong focus on land ramp and card advantage, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with large threats such as Titania and Primeval Titan. The deck is designed to be aggressive, proactive, and resilient in one-on-one matchups.

The deck revolves around ramping up quickly with mana dorks and land fetching spells to accelerate the deployment of high-impact threats like Avenger of Zendikar and Craterhoof Behemoth. Titania, Protector of Argoth synergizes well with the deck's land-based strategy, allowing for token generation and resilience against board wipes. The deck includes several powerful green staples like Primeval Titan and Oracle of Mul Daya to maintain card advantage and board presence. With a focus on aggressive land ramp and powerful green creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive starts and proactive game plan, aiming to establish dominance early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing various control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and flexibility through card draw and selection. By utilizing a wide range of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw engines, the deck aims to control the game and dictate the pace of play. The inclusion of a diverse mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors, enabling the deck to answer a wide range of threats efficiently. The commander, Child of Alara, adds an additional layer of control by acting as a board wipe when needed, providing a safety net against aggressive strategies. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents by carefully managing resources and responding effectively to threats.

This deck focuses on a diverse and powerful control strategy, utilizing a wide range of counterspells, card draw spells, and tutors to outvalue opponents and maintain board control. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to answer threats efficiently while setting up powerful plays with cards like Dream Halls and Omniscience. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Rune-Scarred Demon provide additional win conditions, while the lands are carefully curated to provide the mana needed for the deck's intricate game plan. By utilizing a mix of disruption and powerful card advantage engines, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and grind out wins through incremental advantages and powerful combos.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and resource denial using Grand Arbiter Augustin IV as the commander. The deck includes a mix of permission spells like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Mana Leak, along with removal like Swords to Plowshares and Oblivion Ring. It also features cards like Winter Orb and Rising Waters to slow down opponents and powerful draw engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Ancestral Vision. The deck aims to outvalue opponents with card advantage and efficient answers while utilizing Grand Arbiter Augustin IV's ability to tax opponents' spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and powerful equipment to quickly establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. By incorporating a variety of mana dorks and ramp cards, the deck aims to accelerate its mana production and deploy threats ahead of schedule. The inclusion of disruptive creatures and countermagic spells helps to control the game and protect its key pieces. Additionally, powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine provide additional utility and combat advantages to further enhance the deck's aggression. Overall, the strategy revolves around proactive plays, efficient mana usage, and strong synergy between its creatures and equipment to secure victory through rapid advancement and combat dominance.

The deck focuses on utilizing Karador, Ghost Chieftain as the commander to continuously recur creatures from the graveyard and assemble a powerful combo. It includes various tutors and card draw spells to find the necessary combo pieces quickly. The deck also runs a diverse selection of creatures with useful abilities that can be sacrificed to trigger effects or enable the combo. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's strategy and ensure smooth mana production. Overall, the main goal is to efficiently assemble the combo pieces, control the game with removal spells, and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, disrupting their strategy, and creating card advantage. It utilizes a variety of counter spells such as Counterspell, Force of Will, and Cryptic Command to prevent the opponent from resolving key threats. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods to deal with creatures and sweep the board if needed. It aims to win the game by either locking down the opponent with cards like Blood Moon and Vedalken Shackles, or by assembling a combo with Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Splinter Twin. The commander, Nin, the Pain Artist, provides card draw and a way to deal damage to threats on the board.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with creatures like Llanowar Elves and Birds of Paradise, as well as land ramp spells like Nature's Lore and Edge of Autumn. This allows for explosive plays and casting big threats like Primeval Titan and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger early in the game. The deck also includes powerful utility lands like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter to disrupt opponent's mana base, along with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Sylvan Library for protection and card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and powerful land destruction effects, leading to a quick victory through aggressive plays and efficient use of resources.
